summary: A fullerene is any molecule composed entirely of carbon, in the form of a hollow sphere, ellipsoid, or tube.
full_text:
Sir Harold  Walter Kroto, FRS , is an English chemist. He shared the 1996 Nobel Prize in Chemistry with Robert Curl and Richard Smalley. Kroto is the Francis Eppes Professor of Chemistry at the Florida State University, which he joined in 2004. Prior to that, he spent a large part of his career at the University of Sussex, where he now holds an emeritus professorship.
